revised_title: Magnetic Observations During the Transit of Venus Expedition to Kerguelen Island
tldr: The author describes magnetic observations taken during the Transit of Venus expedition to and from Kerguelen Island. They discuss the dip, intensity, and declination of the Earth's magnetic force at various locations, including the Cape of Good Hope, Bombay, Aden, Port Said, and Malta. The observations were conducted using magnetic instruments, and the results provide insights into the Earth's magnetic field and its variations over time.
